content: The same thing seems to apply to other media. Vice Media has a valuation of $4B on $500M in GAAP revenues, while Time Inc. has a market cap of $1.5B on $3B in revenue. (Incidentally, Disney is a big investor in Vice. Don’t let the kids know.) In a sense, Vice is the main character, but so are their reporters, and they’ve turned that into a franchise. They’ve turned news into a kind of game. There are other technomedia plays that could start the same way.
